title: The pmplots Gallery
text:
Source
The pmtables package is maintained here.
The code for this book is maintained here.


Build

packageVersion("pmtables")

[1] '0.4.1.9003'

date()

[1] "Mon May  2 16:48:24 2022"

title: 2  col//title specification
text:
This is a way to specify the column name for source data along with the axis label
When only the column is given, then the column name will be used for the column title:

title: 2  col//title specification
text:
2.1 Generate using the yspec package
You can also pull col//title data from a yspec object. Load the yspec package and generate an example data specification object

library(yspec)
spec <- ys_help$spec()

Typically, you’ll want to select a subset of columns and then call axis_col_labs()

spec %>% 
  ys_select(WT, AGE, BMI) %>% 
  axis_col_labs()

                WT                AGE                BMI 
 "WT//weight (kg)" "AGE//age (years)" "BMI//BMI (m2/kg)"

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
text: dv_pred(df, yname = .yname)

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
text:
3.2 Observed versus population predicted - log/log

dv_pred(df, loglog=TRUE, yname = .yname)

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
text:
3.3 Observed versus individual predicted (dv_ipred)

dv_ipred(df, yname=.yname)

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
text:
3.4 Observed versus individual predicted - log/log

dv_ipred(df, loglog=TRUE, yname = .yname)

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
section: 3.5 Observed versus both PRED and IPRED
text:
3.5 Observed versus both PRED and IPRED

dv_preds(df) %>% pm_grid(ncol=2)

title: 4  Residual plots
text: res_time(df)

title: 4  Residual plots
section: 4.2 Residuals versus time after first dose (res_tafd)
text:

res_tafd(df)

text:

text:

title: 4  Residual plots
text:
4.5 RES versus continuous covariate (res_cont)

res_cont(df, x="WT//Weight (kg)")




This function is also vectorized in x.

c("WT", "CRCL", "AST") %>% map(.f = partial(res_cont,df)) %>% pm_grid()

title: 4  Residual plots
text:
4.6 RES by categorical covariate (res_cat)

dplyr::count(df, STUDYc)

# A tibble: 4 × 2
  STUDYc      n
  <fct>   <int>
1 SAD       424
2 MAD      1199
3 Renal     960
4 Hepatic   559

res_cat(df, x="STUDYc//Study type")

title: 6  ETA plots
text:
We start by defining a set of ETAs to use in the plots.

etas <- c(
  "ETA1//ETA-CL", 
  "ETA2//ETA-V2", 
  "ETA3//ETA-KA"
)

This is in the col-label format described earlier. We also set out a set of covariates that we can use for ETA diagnostics.

covs <- c(
  "WT//Weight (kg)", 
  "ALB//Albumin (g/dL)", 
  "SCR//Creatinine (mg/dL)"
)

title: 6  ETA plots
text:
6.3 ETA versus continuous covariates (eta_cont)
Grouped by eta

eta_cont(id, x = covs, y = etas[2]) %>% 
  pm_grid()









Grouped by covariate

eta_cont(id, x = covs[1], y = etas) %>% 
  pm_grid(ncol = 2)

title: 6  ETA plots
text:
6.4 ETA by categorical covariates (eta_cat)

eta_cat(id, x = "STUDYc//Study type", y = etas) %>% 
  pm_grid()

title: 6  ETA plots
text:
6.5 ETA histograms [eta_hist]

eta_hist(id, etas, bins = 10) %>% 
  pm_grid()

title: 6  ETA plots
text:
6.6 ETA pairs plot [eta_pairs]

eta_pairs(id, etas)

title: 7  Wrapped plots
text:
Wrapped plots are like the other standardized plots we have seen in the gallery so far, but they allow for a simple faceting using ggplot2::facet_wrap().






Preview the data used on this page





The data are identical to the data used for the other series of plots and do not require any special configuration.

head(as.data.frame(df), n=3)

title: 7  Wrapped plots
text:
7.3 ETA versus continuous

wrap_eta_cont(
  df, 
  y = "ETA1", 
  x = c("WT", "ALB"), 
  scales = "free_x"
)

title: 7  Wrapped plots
text:
7.4 Continuous on categorical

wrap_cont_cat(
  df, 
  y = c("WT", "CRCL", "AAG"), 
  x = "STUDYc", 
  ncol = 2
)

title: 7  Wrapped plots
text:
7.5 Continuous on continuous

wrap_cont_cont(
  df, 
  y = "CWRES" , 
  x = c("WT", "CRCL", "AAG"), 
  ncol = 2, scales = "free_x"
)

title: 7  Wrapped plots
text:
7.6 Residuals versus time

wrap_res_time(
  df, 
  y = c("RES", "WRES", "CWRES"), 
  ncol = 2, scales = "free_y"
)

title: 7  Wrapped plots
text:
7.7 DV/PRED and DV/IPRED

wrap_dv_preds(df, ncol = 2)

title: 7  Wrapped plots
text:
7.8 Use labels in the strip

wrap_eta_cont(
  df, 
  y = "ETA1", 
  x = c("WT//Weight (kg)", "ALB//Albumin (g/dL)"),
  scales = "free_x", 
  use_labels = TRUE
)

title: 8  Pairs plots
text:
This is a simple wrapper around GGally::ggpairs with some customizations that have been developed internally at Metrum over the years.

cols <- c("WT//Weight", "ALB//Albumin", "SCR//Serum creat")
pairs_plot(id, cols)

title: 8  Pairs plots
text:
8.2 Customized lower triangle
Pass a function that customizes the scatter plots on the lower triangle. This function should accept a gg object and add a geom to it

my_lower <- function(p) {
  p + geom_point(aes(color = STUDYc)) + 
    geom_smooth(se = FALSE, color = "black")
}


pairs_plot(id, c("WT", "ALB"), lower_plot = my_lower)

title: 9  Vectorized plots
text:
pm_scatter(df, x = "TIME", y = c("RES", "WRES", "CWRES"))

[[1]]






[[2]]






[[3]]

title: 10  Some customization
text: dv_pred(df, x = "PRED//Concentration ($\\mu$g)")

title: 10  Some customization
text:
10.2 Latex in pairs plot

data <- dplyr::tibble(m = rnorm(100), s = rnorm(100), n = rnorm(100))

x <- c("m//$\\mu$", "s//$\\sigma$", "n//$\\nu$")

pairs_plot(data,x)

title: 10  Some customization
text:
10.3 Latex in wrapped plots

y <- c("WT//Weight (kg)", "BMI//BMI (kg/m$^2$)", "SCR//SCR (g/dL)")

wrap_cont_time(df, y = y, use_labels=TRUE)

title: 10  Some customization
text:
10.4 Modify x-axis

a <- list(trans="log", breaks = logbr3())

dv_time(df, xs=a)

title: 10  Some customization
text:
10.5 Modify y-axis

dv_time(df, ys=a, yname="Y-axis name")

title: 10  Some customization
section: 10.6 Flip coordinates when labels get cramped
text:
10.6 Flip coordinates when labels get cramped
If this is too cramped

cont_cat(
  id, 
  y = c("WT", "BMI", "ALB", "CRCL"), 
  x = "STUDYc"
) %>% pm_grid()




Try this

cont_cat(
  id, 
  y = c("WT", "BMI", "ALB", "CRCL"), 
  x = "STUDYc"
) %>% map(~.x+coord_flip()) %>% pm_grid()

title: 10  Some customization
text:
11.1 smooth

layer_s(p)

title: 10  Some customization
text:
11.2 abline

layer_a(p)





layer_h(cwres_time(df,add_layers=FALSE))

title: 10  Some customization
text:
11.3 Drop extra layers

dv_pred(df, smooth=NULL)





dv_pred(df, abline=NULL)





cwres_time(df, hline = NULL)





dv_pred(df, abline=NULL, smooth = NULL)

title: 10  Some customization
text:
11.4 Modify layer specs
For example, change the values of argument for geom_smooth

cwres_time(df, smooth = list(method = "loess", span = 0.1, se=TRUE))

title: 10  Some customization
text:
11.5 Drop all extra layers

dv_pred(df, add_layers=FALSE)

title: 10  Some customization
text:
14.1 Theme

p + pm_theme()

title: 10  Some customization
text:
14.2 Plain

p + theme_plain()

title: 10  Some customization
text:
14.3 Smooth

p + pm_smooth()

title: 10  Some customization
text:
14.4 Abline

p + pm_abline()

title: 10  Some customization
text:
14.5 Horizontal reference line

ggplot(df, aes(TIME,CWRES)) + geom_point() + pm_hline()

title: 10  Some customization
section: 14.6 Rotate x and y axis labels
text:
14.6 Rotate x and y axis labels

14.6.1 Specify the angle

dv_pred(df) + rot_x(angle = 90) + rot_y()







14.6.2 Rotate to vertical
We are typically rotating the tick labels on the x-axis and frequently it is convenient to ask for a totally vertical rendering

cwres_cat(df, x = "STUDYc") + 
  facet_wrap(~CPc) + rot_x(vertical = TRUE)

title: 11  Data summary
text: cont_cat(id, x="STUDYc", y="WT")

title: 11  Data summary
text:
11.2 General histogram (cont_hist)

cont_hist(id, x = "WT", bins = 20)

title: 11  Data summary
text:
11.3 Split and plot (split_plot)

p <- split_plot(df, sp="STUDYc", fun=dv_ipred)


pm_grid(p)

title: 12  DV-PRED-IPRED
text:
dd1 <- filter(df, ID <= 15)

# dv_pred_ipred(dd1, nrow = 3, ncol = 3, ylab = "Concentration (ng/mL)", log_y=TRUE)

text:

wrap_hist(
  df, 
  x = c("WT", "ALB", "SCR"), 
  scales = "free", 
  bins = 10, 
  ncol = 2
)

title: 6  ETA plots
text:
6.3 ETA versus continuous [eta_cont]
Grouped by eta

eta_cont(id, x = covs, y = etas[2]) %>% 
  pm_grid()









Grouped by covariate

eta_cont(id, x = covs[1], y = etas) %>% 
  pm_grid(ncol = 2)

title: 5  NPDE plots
text:
5.5 Versus continuous [npde_cont]

npde_cont(df, "WT")










5.5.1 Vectorized
These plots can take in a vector of continuous column names and return a list of plots which can be arranged.

covariates <- c("WT", "AGE", "ALB")

npde_cont(df, covariates) %>% 
  pm_grid()
